chapter.title: Quick Installation of &sles4sap;
chapter.para: &slsreg; optimized for SAP applications is available as a downloadable DVD image. The image can be deployed automatically—including automatic installation of validated SAP solutions—or manually.
The current release of the product is based on &sls; &productnumber;.

step.para: Download the DVD ISO image of &sles4sap; 11 (electronic media kit).
Burn the image onto a physical DVD and ensure that it is bootable. Alternatively, you might use a virtual CD-ROM device for installation into a virtual machine.
(Optional) Get the SAP Business All-in-One or another SAP solution for Media-Changer installation media from SAP.

listitem.para: At least 60 GB hard disk space for the system volume and 200 GB for the data partition.

step.para: Insert the &sles4sap; 11 disk in the DVD drive and boot from the DVD.
The DVD boot menu features the following installation options:

listitem.para: Basically a standard SLES installation prepared for installing SAP applications later. You can install the SAP applications either with the provided Installation Wizard or with 3rd party installation routines.
This scenario is suitable for experienced administrators, who want to install &sles4sap; according to their own plan.

term.guimenu: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard

listitem.para: This is a semi-automated installation of the operating system with default settings. At the end, the Installation Wizard for the installation of SAP applications will be started on demand. The user has the possibility to set the most important parameters for a basic installation of the system and the installation of the specified SAP applications.

term.guimenu: SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with External Profile

listitem.para: This installation is driven by a user provided &ay; profile.
This scenario is suitable for experienced users, who are familiar with with &ay; and want to deploy their own &ay; profiles to install &sles4sap;.

step.para: Select SLES for SAP Applications — Installation with Wizard and press enter to start the semi-automated installation procedure. For details and caveats, see .

&yast; starts. Confirm the System Volume Configuration. If &yast; detects more than one hard disk, select one for the system volume, where you want &yast; to install SLES operating system—the other disk will you used for the SAP applications.
Continue with installation and basic initial configuration.
At the end, continue with the installation of the SAP applications.

section.title: Installation of &sles4sap;
section.para: The normal &ay; driven SLES for SAP Applications installation without using the SAP Media-Changer for the customer.

The process is similar to &sles4sap;. The &suselinux; installation will start (partitioning, LVM setup and file system creation, installation of Linux software packages). This step takes typically less than 10 min. (it depends on the hardware, of course). After the automatic system reboot (do not change the default "Boot from Hard Disk" in case you left the DVD inserted), the system will provide some dialogs for basic system settings. The Media-Changer will not start for installation of a validated SAP solution. If the Media-Changer should be used to install a validated SAP solution, it can be started manually from within &yast;.

section.title: Installation of &sles4sap; with Wizard
section.para: The normal &ay; driven SLES for SAP Applications installation including SAP solution installation using the SAP Media-Changer for the customer.

The &suselinux; installation will start (partitioning, LVM setup and file system creation, installation of Linux software packages). This step typically takes less than 10 minutes (it depends on the hardware, of course). After the automatic system reboot (do not change the default "Boot from Hard Disk" in case you left the DVD inserted), you will be prompted to insert the SAP installation media; then follow the instructions.

section.title: Installation of &sles4sap; with External Profile
section.para: &ay; will look on USB devices for the XML configuration file (external profile). Plug in an USB device and store your config in a way like it is on the DVD in the /rules directory.

In order to use a custom &ay; script or perform a complete manual installation and configuration of &sles4sap; select the "Install SLES for SAP Applications Manual Profile via USB" boot menu entry. Within the boot options change the autoyast=usb:/// parameter to the location of a custom &ay; script to use for automatic installation. Alternatively, completely remove the autoyast=usb:/// parameter to perform a manual installation and configuration of &sles4sap;.
You can choose the SAP specific pattern, the HA, WebYaST components and SAP specific IBM Java as well in this installation scenario, but they are not preselected.

section.title: SAP Specific Instructions
section.para: For further installation instructions and the SAP specific parts in particular, refer to the SAP Installation Guide (the Cookbook).

section.title: How to Install with Installation Media from the Network

step.para: Copy the &sles4sap; DVD content to a Web server (e.g., example.com) into the directory /srv/www/htdocs/mydir.

Choose one of the bootmenu options and edit the command line: Remove the parameters instmode=cd netsetup=0 from the commandline and change autoyast=file:/// to autoyast=http://example.com/mydir/ and add the parameter install=http://example.com/mydir.

section.para: That is all you need for a network installation. If you want to avoid using a DVD to bootstrap the system and boot from the network via PXE, read the documentation about setting up a PXE environment ().

section.title: Media Changer and Network Sources
section.para: If you want to put your media on a NFS Server, proceed as follows:

step.para: Create a directory /srv/www/htdocs/sap_test on your installation server.
Edit your /etc/exports file on the installation server by adding the following:
Create a directory for every SAP Media you have, for example /srv/www/htdocs/sap_test/sapcd1.
Copy the content of all SAP Medias to the corresponding directory.

section.para: Now the media changer can also install from your NFS server.
